title: 17k-Mile 2008 Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 Coupe
interior_color: Marrone Janus Upholstery w/Q-Citura Quilted Inserts
listing_details: Marrone Janus Upholstery w/Q-Citura Quilted Inserts
Carbon-Fiber Interior and Engine Bay Trim
excerpt: This 2008 Lamborghini Murciélago LP640 coupe is said to have been exhibited by Lamborghini to showcase their Ad Personam program, and it also participated at the Concorso Italiano event during Monterey Car Week in 2017 and 2018, where it was awarded second and first place, respectively. The car is believed to be the only coupe finished in Blu Cepheus, and it has 17k miles through the seller’s purchase in 2016. Powered by a 6.5-liter V12 that drives all four wheels through an E-gear six-speed automated transmission, the car is equipped with Marrone Janus upholstery with Q-Citura quilted inserts, a GMG exhaust system, a Kenwood stereo, a limited-slip rear differential, black 18″ Hemera alloy wheels, carbon-fiber interior and engine bay trim, carbon-ceramic brakes, a front-axle lift system, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel, automatically deploying rear intakes, a rearview camera, and automatic climate control. This Murciélago LP640 coupe is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a car cover, a Carfax report, and a California title.

The Murciélago was designed by Luc Donckerwolke and was publicly unveiled in 2001 at the Frankfurt Motor Show as the replacement for the Diablo. According to the seller, this example is the only coupe finished in Blu Cepheus. Exterior details include a speed-activated rear spoiler, a pantograph windshield wiper, xenon headlights, scissor doors, rear fog lights, a hexagonal exhaust outlet, and automatically deploying rear intakes to aid in cooling. Damage to the front is listed in a November 2015 entry of the Carfax report. The car received paintwork in 2016 and 2019, and the front bumper cover and rocker panels were also refinished in 2025. Paint protection film has been applied to the front bumper cover, hood, and lower rocker panels, per the seller, who notes paint chips on the rocker panels.

The 18″ Hemera alloy wheels were refinished in May 2025, at which time they were mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires. The TPMS sensors and front wheel bearings were replaced, and the brake fluid was also flushed at that time. Stopping power is provided by black-finished calipers fitted over cross-drilled ceramic-composite rotors at each corner, and the car is equipped with active dampers and a front-axle lift system.

The cabin houses manually adjustable seats trimmed in Marrone Janus upholstery with Q-Citura quilted inserts, and appointments include carbon-fiber trim, carpeted floor mats, a rearview camera, automatic climate control, inboard shoulder restraints, a JL Audio amplifier, and a Kenwood stereo.

The carbon-fiber-trimmed steering wheel features carbon-fiber paddle shifters and frames a 220-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer as well as auxiliary gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and oil temperature. The digital odometer indicates 17k miles, approximately 7k of which were added under current ownership.

The carbon-fiber-trimmed engine bay houses the mid-mounted 6.5-liter V12, which was factory rated at 632 horsepower and 487 lb-ft of torque. Work in May 2025 included adjusting the valves, rebuilding the starter, changing the oil, and replacing the battery, drive belt, air filters, spark plugs, engine mounts, lower intake manifold gasket, and valve cover gaskets. The car passed an emissions inspection in November 2025.
A Valentino Balboni signature adorns the carbon-fiber engine bay trim.

Power is routed to all four wheels via an E-gear six-speed automated transmission and a limited-slip rear differential. The transmission fluid was replaced in May 2025, and the car is equipped with a GMG exhaust system.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage.
There is currently a lien out on the car, and the seller’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.

title: 5,400-Mile 2005 Lamborghini Murcielago Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 Lamborghini Murciélago coupe is powered by a 6.2-liter V12 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Giallo Orion over Nero Perseus and Giallo Taurus leather upholstery. Equipment includes limited-slip rear differentials, 18″ Hercules alloy wheels, a speed-activated rear spoiler, xenon headlights, automatically deploying rear intakes, automatic climate control, and a CD stereo. Registration history includes Florida and Ohio, and the odometer now indicates 5,400 miles. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this Murciélago coupe is offered in California with two key fobs, a tool kit, a battery charger, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title.

The Murciélago was designed by Luc Donckerwolke and was unveiled to the public in 2001 at the Frankfurt Motor Show as the replacement for the Diablo. This example is finished in Giallo Orion and features a speed-activated rear spoiler, a pantograph windshield wiper, xenon headlights, scissor doors, rear fog lights, dual exhaust outlets, and automatically deploying rear intakes to aid in cooling.

Silver-finished 18″ Hercules wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 335/30 rear Pirelli P Zero Rosso tires. The car is equipped with active dampers, and braking is provided by yellow-finished calipers along with a cross-drilled rotor at each corner. The brake fluid was flushed in July 2025.

The manually adjustable seats are upholstered in Nero Perseus leather with Giallo Taurus inserts and yellow stitching, and the dashboard, center console, and door panels are trimmed to match. Additional appointments include automatic climate control, a gated shifter, inboard shoulder restraints, and a CD stereo.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 220-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer as well as gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and oil temperature. The digital odometer indicates 5,400 miles.

The mid-mounted 6.2-liter V12 was factory rated at 572 horsepower and 479 lb-ft of torque. Per the Carfax report, work in July 2025 included servicing the cooling system, changing the oil, and replacing a serpentine belt and one or more spark plugs.
Power is routed to all four wheels via a six-speed manual transmission along with front and rear limited-slip differentials.
A tool kit and battery charger will accompany the vehicle.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report is free of accident or damage entries.

title: RWD-Converted 2005 Lamborghini Murcielago Coupe
excerpt: This 2005 Lamborghini Murciélago coupe underwent a rear-wheel-drive conversion and was fitted with black LP 670-4 Superveloce–style bodywork as well as 19″ and 20″ BBS multi-piece wheels before being acquired by the selling dealer in 2025. Finished in Grigio Antares over Nero Perseus leather, the car is powered by a 6.2-liter V12 coupled linked with an E-gear six-speed automated transmission and a limited-slip rear differential. It is further equipped with a front-axle lift system, red-finished brake calipers, and scissor doors along with carbon-fiber interior trim and a Sony head unit. This Murciélago coupe has 48k miles and is now offered by the selling dealer with a clean California title.

Publicly unveiled in 2001 at the Frankfurt Motor Show, the Murciélago was designed by Luc Donckerwolke as the replacement for the Diablo. This example left the factory finished in Grigio Antares and was fitted with black LP 670-4 Superveloce–style bodywork from the German company DMC under previous ownership. The automatically deploying rear intakes have been programmed to remain up., and further details include xenon headlights, scissor doors, and a pantograph windshield wiper.

The 19″ front and 20″ rear BBS multi-piece wheels are mounted with Toyo Proxes Sport tires measuring 235/35 and 345/25 respectively. The car is equipped with active dampers as well as a front-axle lift system, while stopping power is provided by red-finished calipers fitted over cross-drilled rotors at each corner. The right-rear wheel is bent.

The cabin houses manually adjustable seats trimmed in Nero Perseus leather and is accented with carbon-fiber trim. A Sony head unit has been added, and further amenities include automatic climate control, inboard shoulder restraints, and power-folding mirrors. Wear is visible on various interior surfaces.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel sits ahead of column-mounted aluminum shift paddles. Instrumentation consists of a 220-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer as well as auxiliary gauges for fuel level, coolant temperature, oil pressure, and oil temperature. The digital odometer indicates 48k miles.

The mid-mounted 6.2-liter V12 was factory rated at 572 horsepower and 479 lb-ft of torque. The selling dealer notes that the car has a modified exhaust system and is not equipped with catalytic converters. A replacement oxygen sensor was recently installed.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via an E-gear six-speed automated transmission and a limited-slip rear differential. The front driveshaft, differential, and halfshafts have been removed.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. A lien is noted on the report, but it was released in October 2025.
The car cannot pass a California emissions test, therefore it cannot be sold to an in-state private party buyer.

title: 24k-Mile 2008 Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 Roadster
excerpt: This 2008 Lamborghini Murciélago LP640 roadster is finished in Blu Monterey over Nero Perseus leather with blue stitching and is modified with a rear-wheel-drive conversion, an LOC exhaust, 19″ and 20″ HRE wheels, and a custom sound system. It is powered by a 6.5-liter V12 linked with an E-gear six-speed automated transmission and a limited-slip rear differential. Other equipment includes a clear engine cover, a Black soft top, ceramic-composite brakes, a front-axle lift system, a speed-activated rear spoiler, and automatically deploying rear intakes. The current owner acquired the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 5k of the 24k indicated miles. This Murciélago LP640 roadster is now offered in Washington state on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual, service records, removed parts, spare wheels and tires, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.

The Murciélago was designed by Luc Donckerwolke and was publicly unveiled in 2001 at the Frankfurt Motor Show as the replacement for the Diablo. This example is finished in Blu Monterey, a color the selling dealer notes as special-order only, and it is further outfitted with a Black removable soft top, a clear engine cover, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a pantograph windshield wiper, carbon-fiber wind deflectors, xenon headlights, scissor doors, rear fog lights, a hexagonal exhaust outlet, and automatically deploying rear intakes to aid in cooling. The selling dealer reports that clear paint protection film covers the front trunk lid, fenders, quarter panels, and side skirts.
The photos were taken in December 2024.

Black 19″ and 20″ HRE wheels are mounted with 255/30 front and 325/25 rear Pirelli P Zero tires. Stopping power is provided by blue-finished calipers fitted over cross-drilled ceramic-composite rotors at each corner. The car is equipped with a front-axle lift system. The power steering pump was rebuilt in June 2014.

The selling dealer tells us that the car was ordered with the Interior Carbon Fiber and Branding packages, and the manually adjustable seats are trimmed in Nero Perseus leather with blue stitching and Q-Citura quilted inserts. The interior also offers automatic climate control, inboard shoulder restraints, and a touchscreen stereo hooked to Focal speakers and JL Audio amplifiers.

The leather- and carbon-fiber-rimmed steering wheel features carbon-fiber paddle shifters and frames a 220-mph speedometer and a 9k-rpm tachometer as well as auxiliary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 24k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.

The mid-mounted 6.5-liter V12 was factory rated at 632 horsepower and 487 lb-ft of torque and is linked with an E-gear six-speed automated transmission and a limited-slip rear differential. A carbon-fiber X-brace is installed. The selling dealer tells us that the car has been converted to rear-wheel drive, and that a Lamborghini of Orange County (LOC) exhaust system is installed. Records indicate that the clutch assembly was replaced in December 2013 at 11k miles, the E-gear valve assembly was replaced in April 2014, the alternator was replaced in June 2014, and the valves were adjusted in June 2017.

A spare set of Hermera wheels and Michelin tires is included in the sale along with the removed factory secondary catalytic converters and front drive components. Manufacturer’s literature and service records will also accompany the car.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
